cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 5 mi (10 km) north of Barbuda
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across the northern Leeward Islands, near the northern Virgin Islands on Wednesday, then toward Puerto Rico and the Bahamas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Virgin Islands (close pass of St. Thomas/ St. John area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: U.S. Virgin Islands, British Virgin Islands, northern Leeward Islands, Puerto Rico and nearby islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, British & U.S. Virgin Islands (including St. Croix), Puerto Rico, northern Dominican Republic coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are very likely (94% chance); brief hurricane-force gusts possible as the eye passes north of St. Croix Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft of surge possible along the south coast of St. Croix; higher run-up on north-facing shores exposed to onshore flow.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain expected; localized higher totals possible in heavy squalls.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and life-threatening rip currents expected around the island.
